description: Motzkin triangle, T, read by rows; T(0,0) = T(1,0) = T(1,1) = 1; for n >= 2, T(n,0) = 1, T(n,k) = T(n-1,k-2) + T(n-1,k-1) + T(n-1,k) for k = 1,2,...,n-1 and T(n,n) = T(n-1,n-2) + T(n-1,n-1).
comments: Right-hand columns have g.f. M^k, where M is g.f. of Motzkin numbers.Consider a semi-infinite chessboard with squares labeled (n,k), ranks or rows n >= 0, files or columns k >= 0; number of king-paths of length n from (0,0) to (n,k), 0 <= k <= n, is T(n,n-k). - _Harrie Grondijs_, May 27 2005. Cf. A114929, A111808, A114972.

formula: T(n,k) = Sum_{i=0..floor(k/2)} binomial(n, 2i+n-k)(binomial(2i+n-k, i) - binomial(2i+n-k, i-1)). - _Herbert Kociemba_, May 27 2004T(n,k) = A027907(n,k) - A027907(n,k-2), k<=n.Sum_{k=0..n}(-1)^k*T(n,k) = A099323(n+1). - _Philippe Deléham_, Mar 19 2007Sum_{k=0..n}(T(n,k) mod 2) = A097357(n+1). - _Philippe Deléham_, Apr 28 2007Sum_{k=0..n} T(n,k)*x^(n-k) = A005043(n), A001006(n), A005773(n+1), A059738(n) for x = -1, 0, 1, 2 respectively. - _Philippe Deléham_, Nov 28 2009
